refnamediv.refpurpose: Sort an array using a "natural order" algorithm

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function implements a sort algorithm that orders alphanumeric strings in the way a human being would. This is described as a "natural ordering". An example of the difference between this algorithm and the regular computer string sorting algorithms (used in sort) can be seen below:

example.title: natsort example
example.programlisting:
<?php
$array1 = $array2 = array ("img12.png", "img10.png", "img2.png", "img1.png");

sort($array1);
echo "Standard sorting\n";
print_r($array1);

natsort($array2);
echo "\nNatural order sorting\n";
print_r($array2);
?>
example.para: The code above will generate the following output:
example.screen:
Standard sorting Array ( [0] => img1.png [1] => img10.png [2] => img12.png [3] => img2.png )
Natural order sorting Array ( [3] => img1.png [2] => img2.png [1] => img10.png [0] => img12.png )
example.para: For more information see: Martin Pool's Natural Order String Comparison page.

note.para: If you're wanting to maintain index/value associations, consider using uasort($arr, 'strnatcmp').

refsect1.para: See also natcasesort, strnatcmp, and strnatcasecmp.
